title: POLARIS Spaceplanes Perform First Flight of MIRA Demonstrator
summary:
Bremen-based startup POLARIS Spaceplanes has completed the first flight of its MIRA demonstrator. The flight lasted for 2.5 minutes and covered a total distance of approximately nine kilometres. MIRA is a 4.3-metre demonstrator that features a fiber-reinforced shell and a 5.2-square-metre wing area. The demonstrator is powered by four kerosene-fed jet engines and one of […]
The post POLARIS Spaceplanes Perform First Flight of MIRA Demonstrator appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: China’s iSpace launches and lands rocket test stage
summary: Chinese commercial rocket company iSpace has successfully launched and safely landed a test article on its path to developing a reusable launch vehicle.

title: Netherlands and Iceland sign Artemis Accords
summary: Two more countries have signed the U.S.-led Artemis Accords outlining best practices in space exploration, one of which did so with no fanfare.
